newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian lev closes weaker at 745-750 per dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian lev closes weaker at 745-750 per dollar.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev fell to 745-750 per dollar at Monday's close, down from around 737 in the morning as foreign currency demand topped supply in thin interbank volume, dealers said.
"A large oil importer has been bidding for dollars since the morning but supply was rather low and the lev lost some 25 from last week," said a dealer. The lev closed at 720-725 on Friday.
Traders said that the lev was likely to continue falling mainly because of the current political instability which delayed foreign funding.
"Every foreign currency bid now pressures the lev no matter how small it is," another dealer said.
